page.title: 08Family Life in Bristol
page.content: I woke up at 7.30 a.m. Mum said we were going to go down to the Bristol Docks after dinner to see the Power Boat racing. When I was dressed, I went to call for Sharon, my friend. We went down to the market. She bought a red coat costing Â£19.99. I bought a dress costing Â£9.99. We went home and had dinner - pork, potatoes and cabbage. After dinner we went to the Docks. All the boats were zooming round the course, going really fast. It was very good. Afterwards we went to the {Lifeboat Museum} to see all the old boats. When we got home it was 5 p.m. I went out on the playing field till 8 p.m. then I came in, had a piece of toast, watched "Murder She Wrote" on T.V. till 9 p.m., then I went to bed and read till 10 p.m.
